author: Richard Rowe
comment: Seems to work well, and is accurate enough for my needs. I was bummed to find out that all stats aren't saved for review after ending trip. All you're able to see after ending is a map view. Stats such as time, average speed, and maximum speed are lost as soon as you tap "end trip". If you're interested in saving those be sure to write them down someplace before you end. If saving those can be implemented somehow I would likely raise to 5 stars.

author: Kenneth Shields
comment: I can find the trip stats after the trip is finished other than the map. Also I just came home from the store and the app said I maxed out my speed at 581.9mph no wonder people were flipping me off.
title: Not very useful.

comment: So far its accurate but I was really hoping it would give me a log of the miles I traveled.

comment: Tried playing music thru headphones the same time running trip tracker, turn off tracker, music works fine.
title: No support option

author: Allan Roberts
comment: I can now change my review :) this app works fantastically, it starts and stops it's self and uses a proper card notification rather than an open app. App has good support on the development side and is updated well.

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Thank for your feedback Allan. I've replied to your email. For anyone else reading, a major update is in progress (including a fix for this issue) and should be ready any day now.

title: It does what it says

author: Jim Thibault
comment: Thanks for updating the feedback, I just reinstalled and will try it out

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Hi Jim, thanks for your feedback. An update has just been released that improves battery consumption, and some other stability fixes. It also now includes a sensitivity setting for the auto-start feature, so that you can reduce the likelihood of false starts.

title: Pretty Good

author: Reda Berradi
comment: The math and estimation in this app are not accurate, I will say that it detects that you are driving and launch but it does not get the accurate speed and distance sometimes

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback. All distance calculations are done by the Android API, so there are no math errors. The issue is with the accuracy your device's GPS location, which can be poor due to a variety of factors. It's an unfortunate, but unavoidable limitation of the GPS device. As the description says, this should be used only as a rough guide.

title: Not that accurate

author: eric mcdonald
comment: Should also add mph for us market.Thanks.

reply.author: DMB
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback. There is already the option to change it to imperial units (mph/miles) and nautical units (knots/nautical miles). The settings can be accessed from the app on your handheld device.
